Tidy a model with parameters package

Source: R/tidiers.R
tidy_parameters.Rd

Use parameters::model_parameters() to tidy a model and apply parameters::standardize_names(style = "broom") to the output

tidy_parameters(x, conf.int = TRUE, conf.level = 0.95, ...)

Arguments

x

a model
conf.int

logical indicating whether or not to include a confidence interval in the tidied output
conf.level

the confidence level to use for the confidence interval
...

additional parameters passed to parameters::model_parameters()

See also

Other custom_tieders: tidy_with_broom_or_parameters()

Examples

if (require(parameters)) {
  lm(Sepal.Length ~ Sepal.Width + Species, data = iris) %>%
    tidy_parameters()
}

#> Loading required package: parameters
#>                term  estimate std.error  conf.low conf.high statistic df.error
#> 1       (Intercept) 2.2513932 0.3697543 1.5206309  2.982156  6.088890      146
#> 2       Sepal.Width 0.8035609 0.1063390 0.5933983  1.013723  7.556598      146
#> 3 Speciesversicolor 1.4587431 0.1121079 1.2371791  1.680307 13.011954      146
#> 4  Speciesvirginica 1.9468166 0.1000150 1.7491525  2.144481 19.465255      146
#>        p.value
#> 1 9.568102e-09
#> 2 4.187340e-12
#> 3 3.478232e-26
#> 4 2.094475e-42
